task.title: Vehicle Maintenance
task.shortdesc: Essential maintenance procedures to keep your vehicle in optimal condition.

prereq.p: Before performing maintenance, ensure your vehicle is parked on a level surface with the engine off and cool. Have appropriate tools and safety equipment ready.

context.p: Regular maintenance extends your vehicle's lifespan, improves reliability, maintains fuel efficiency, preserves resale value, and enhances safety. The following sections outline essential maintenance procedures for different vehicle systems.

step.cmd: Check engine oil level and condition

info.p: Locate the dipstick, remove and wipe clean, reinsert fully, and check the oil level indication. Oil should be between minimum and maximum marks and appear clean, not dark and gritty.
Recommended frequency: Monthly and before long trips
Use a tire pressure gauge to check all tires against specifications usually found on a label inside the driver's door jamb. Inspect for abnormal wear patterns, cuts, bulges, or embedded objects.
Recommended frequency: Monthly and before long trips
Check coolant, brake fluid, power steering fluid, and windshield washer fluid levels. Ensure all are between minimum and maximum marks on their respective reservoirs.
Verify functionality of headlights (low and high beam), tail lights, brake lights, turn signals, hazard lights, and reverse lights. Replace any non-functional bulbs.
Drain old oil, replace oil filter, and refill with manufacturer-recommended oil type and quantity.
Recommended frequency: Every 5,000-7,500 miles (8,000-12,000 km) or per manufacturer's recommendations
Swap tire positions according to manufacturer's recommended pattern to ensure even wear.
Remove and replace engine air filter if it appears dirty or clogged.
Recommended frequency: Every 15,000-30,000 miles (24,000-48,000 km) or as needed
Check brake pad thickness, rotor condition, and brake fluid quality.

result.p: Following these maintenance procedures will help ensure your vehicle operates reliably, efficiently, and safely throughout its lifespan.

example.p: Create a maintenance log to track service history, including dates, mileage, services performed, and parts replaced. This documentation is valuable for warranty purposes and when selling the vehicle.
